title.text: A demo of FORGe: the Pompeu Fabra Open Rule-based Generator

abstractContent.text: This demo paper presents the multilingual deep sentence generator developed by the TALN group at Universitat Pompeu Fabra, implemented as a series of rule-based graph-transducers.

entities.text: TALN group at Universitat Pompeu Fabra

introductionContent.text: FORGe ( 1 is a pipeline of graph transducers which, coupled with lexical resources, allows for generating texts, starting from a variety of abstract input structures.

The current generator has been mainly developed for English on the dependency Penn Treebank) automatically converted to predicateargument structures, and on Abstract Meaning Representations, using the SemEval'17 data.
It is currently being adapted to languages such as Spanish, German French, and Polish, in the context of ontology-to-text generation as part of a dialogue system.

Our generator follows the theoretical model of the Meaning-Text Theory, and performs the following actions: (i) syntacticization of predicate-argument graphs; (ii) introduction of function words; (iii) linearization and retrieval of surface forms.
